instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 315 - Should employees from countries other than the countries having SSA with India, contribute as International Workers ?
Answer: Ans : Each and every worker from a country not having either SSA or bilateral comprehensive economic agreement (referred to in answer under FAQ 2) with India has to contribute mandatorily.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 316 - Whether an International Worker employed in India and being paid in foreign currency are coverable ?
Answer: Ans : Yes, IWs drawing salary in any currency and in any manner are to be covered as IWs. The contribution in respect of such IWs will be computed in INR. The rate of conversion of that currency shall be the telegraphic transfer buying rate offered by the State Bank of India for buying such currency on the last working day of the month for which wages is due.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 317 - Whether a foreigner employed directly by an Indian establishment is coverable ?
Answer: Ans : A foreigner employed directly by an Indian establishment would be coverable, if the establishment is covered/coverable under the EPF and MP Act, 1952.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 318 - What is condition for receiving the withdrawal benefit in case of International Workers from SSA countries, under EPS, 1995 ?
Answer: Ans :  Only, those IWs who are covered by a SSA will be eligible for withdrawal benefit under the EPS, 1995 provided they have not rendered the eligible service (i.e.10 years) even after including the totalisation benefit, if any, as may be provided in the said agreement.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 319 - What is the condition for receiving the withdrawal benefit in case of International Workers from Non SSA countries, under EPS, 1995 ?
Answer: Ans : In case of IWs from Non SSA countries, withdrawal benefit under the EPS, 1995 will not be available.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 320 - Under what circumstances accumulations in the PF account are payable to an International Worker ?
Answer:
Ans : 
 The full amount standing to the credit of a member’s account is payable in the following circumstances:
 a. Persons covered SSA – On ceasing to be an employee in an establishment covered under the Act.
 b. Persons NOT covered SSA – 
 (i) On retirement from service in the establishment at any time after 58 years of age;
 (ii) On retirement on account of permanent and total incapacity for work due to bodily or mental infirmity, duly certified by the authorized medical officer.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 321 - What is certificate of coverage (COC)?
Answer:
Ans : Certificate of Coverage (COC) is a certificate issued by the liaison Agencies of the respective SSA country, with whom India has signed Social Security Agreement (SSA), certifying therein that the person who is being deputed India, is covered under the Social Security System of his home country.

EPFO issues COC in respect of Indian workers being deputed to SSA countries and based on this Certificate Indian Workers are entitled to exemption from contributing under Social Security System of host country.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 322 - Who is the Competent Authority to issue the certificate of coverage ?
Answer: Ans : The office of the Regional PF Commissioners are the competent Authorities to issue the COC in respect in respect of Indian Workers being deputed to SSA countries.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 323 - Whether Overseas Citizen of India (OCI/Person of Indian Origin (PIO) card holder will be treated as IWs ?
Answer: Ans : All foreign nationals, including OCI/PIO card holders are required to be enrolled and comply with EPFO, as IWs.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 324 - Whether pension benefits can be availed by the claimant belonging to SSA country in their home country ?
Answer: Ans : Yes, as portability has been provided in the SSAs, the persons covered under such SSA can opt for payment of Pension benefits in their home country .
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 325 - What is the procedure for getting Certificate of Coverage in respect of a person posted to a country having SSA with India ?
Answer: Ans : For availing the COC, the prescribed online application forms, available on International Workers Portal on the official website of EPFO, needs to be filled up by the employee, approved by the employer using e-sign and submitted online to the office of EPFO, under whose jurisdiction the establishment is registered.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 326 - Whether Nepalese & Bhutanese nationals are International Workers ?
Answer: Ans : The proviso to Substituted Para 2(ja) under Para 83 of the EPF Scheme provides that Nepalese and Bhutanese nationals shall be deemed to be Indian Workers.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 327 - Is there a cap on the salary up to which contribution has to be made under the EDLI Scheme, 1976 ?
Answer: Ans : Yes, contribution in the EDLI Scheme has to be made on the wage ceiling of Rs 15000/- .
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 328 - If my last working date as per my resignation is different from the last office attendance date, then what will be my DoE in my PF account?
Answer: Ans : Last working date or the date till when the wages earned is the date of exit .
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 329 - How can I register e-Sign of the authorized signatory ?
Answer:
Ans : 
 Employer has to provide virtual id and basic details   (Name, DOB, and   Gender) of the authorized signatory. System will verify the basic details from Aadhaar database. If details match, request letter for registration of authorized signatory will be generated.
 Following is the brief Process flow:
 Step 1: Login to Employer Interface of Unified Portal of EPFO. Link is given below: https://unifiedportal-emp.epfindia.gov.in/epfo/
 Step 2: Go to Establishment >> DSC/e-Sign 
 Step 3: Click on e-Sign
 Step 4: Enter Virtual ID and basic details of authorized signatory
 Step 5: Click on view DSC/e-Sign registration (Top on right hand side) 
 Step 6: Click on “Generate Request Letter” and print it on establishment Letter Head.
 Step 7: After specimen signature of authorized person upload the scanned letter which is duly signed by employer at the portal.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 330 - How can the employer generate UAN for newly joined employees not having UAN ?
Answer:
Ans : 
Employer can generate the UAN for newly joined employees individually or in bulk by 
Following the below given steps:
UAN generation for individual employee
 -> Employer will login on Employer Interface of Unified Portal.
 -> Click On Member>>Register-Individual
 -> Enter the Employee’s details such as Aadhar, Name, Date of Birth, Gender, Father’s/Husband Name, Date of Joining, EPF Wages as on joining, Bank Account and PAN etc.
 -> System will validate the Name, Date of birth and Gender with UIDAI database. 
 -> After saving the information, record will move to the “Approval” section.
 -> Approve all details in the “Approval” section. UAN will be allotted.
 -> How can an employee generate his UAN on his own?
UAN generation in bulk
If employer wants to generate the UANs of more than one employee at once, below steps may be followed:
 -> Employer will login on Employer Interface of Unified Portal.
 -> Click on Member>>Register-Bulk
 -> Upload the file. (Format of the file can be downloaded by clicking on “Help File”
 -> Approve the file in “Approval” section. UAN will be allotted to all the employees of uploaded file.
An employee can generate his UAN directly by visiting the unified member portal ‘https://unifiedportal-mem.epfindia.gov.in/memberinterface’ and clicking on Direct UAN Allotment by Employees. A valid Aadhaar number with registered mobile is pre- requisite to avail this facility. Employee has to provide employment details to obtain UAN.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 331 - What are the documents required for change in Date of Birth of EPF members ?
Answer:
Ans : 
 Any of the following documents may be accepted as valid proof of date of birth:
 • Birth certificate issued by the Registrar of Births and Deaths
 • Any School / education related certificate
 • Certificate based on the service records of the Central/State Government Organization.
 • Passport
 • Any other reliable document issued by a Government department.
 • In the absence of proof of date of birth as above, Medical certificate issued by
Civil Surgeon after examining the member medically and supported with an affidavit on oath by the member duly authenticated by a competent court.
 • Aadhaar /e-Aadhaar:
The change in date of birth shall be accepted  as  per  Aadhaar  /  e- Aadhaar  upto   a   maximum   range   of   plus   or   minus   three    years     of the date of birth recorded earlier with EPFO.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 332 - What is the objective of this Scheme?
Answer:
Ans : The Central Govt. announced Pradhan Mantri Garib Kayan Yojana Package to help the poor fight the COVID-19 pandemic. As part of this package, with the objective to prevent disruption in the employment of low wage earning employees and support businesses employing less than one hundred employees, the Central Govt. has decided to pay 24 percent of the monthly wages into their EPF accounts for three months.
To implement the package, the Ministry of Labour, Govt. of India has approved Scheme guidelines.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 333 - What are the effective months during which this Scheme is being implemented?
Answer: Ans : This Scheme will be valid for wage months- March, 2020, April, 2020 and May 2020.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 334 - Which are the establishments eligible for getting the benefit of contributions from Central Govt.?
Answer:
Ans : 
For any establishment to be eligible for benefits,
 (i)  The establishment or factory should already be covered and registered under the Employees’ Provident Funds & Misc. Provisions Act, 1952.
 (ii) The total number of employees employed in the establishment should be up to 100 (one hundred), with 90% or more of such employees should be drawing monthly wages less than Rs.15000/-.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 335 - Are all employees of eligible establishment eligible for the Central Govt. relief under this Scheme?
Answer:
Ans : 
For an employee to be eligible for benefits,
 (i) Employee should be employed in any eligible establishment earning monthly wages of less than Rs.15000/- and his UAN should be seeded with his/her  Aadhaar.
 (ii) Employee should be a member of EPF Scheme, 1952 & Employees’ Pension Scheme, 1995 whose contributions are received for any period during last six months (wage months: September 2019 to February 2020) in the ECR filed by any eligible establishment against his/her UAN.
Such contributions in ECR should have been received on monthly wage of less than Rs.15000/-.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
336 - Whether an employee, earning less than Rs.15000/- employed in an eligible estt who is no longer a member of EPS, 1995 due his attaining age of 58 years
 
but is a member of EPF Scheme, 1952 eligible for relief under this Scheme?
Answer: Ans : EPF members who are not EPS members due to completion of 58 years shall be eligible provided other conditions are fulfilled and the contribution from Central Govt. will be credited to his EPF account.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 337 - Can you illustrate the verification of eligibility of an EPF covered establishment for benefit under this Scheme?
Answer:
Ans : 
 If an establishment already covered under the EPF & MP Act, 1952 has remitted contributions in respect of fifty employees for the month of February, 2020, through ECR and on verification of ECR, it is found that for 46 employees (92% of 50 employees), the contributions are paid on wages less than Rs.15000/-, the establishment is eligible.
 All the 46 employees earning wages less than Rs.15000/- are eligible for benefit.
 If the above situation of total employees up to 100 and 90% or more of employees earning monthly wage of less than Rs.15000/- prevails in wage month of March, 2020, April, 2020 and May 2020, the establishment is eligible for benefit under this Scheme.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 338 - What is the quantum of Central Govt. relief under this Scheme ?
Answer: Ans : The entire employee’s EPF contributions (12% of wages) and employer’s EPF & EPS contribution (12% of wages), totalling 24% of the monthly wages for the next three months shall be directly paid by the Central Govt. in the EPF accounts (UAN) of eligible employees in employed in eligible establishments.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 339 - Whether employee is defined for the purpose of this Scheme?
Answer: Ans : The definition of employee as contained in sec 2(f) of the EPF & MP Act, 1952 as well as other definitions in EPF & MP Act, 1952 are mutatis mutandis applicable to this Scheme.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 340 - Who will be considered as contributory member for determining eligibility?
Answer: Ans : Employee, employed in eligible establishment, should be a contributory member of EPF Scheme, 1952 & Employees’ Pension Scheme, 1995, whose contributions are received against his/her UAN for any period during last six months (wage months- September 2019 to February 2020) in the ECR filed by any eligible establishment.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 341 - How an eligible employee is benefitted by this Scheme?
Answer:
Ans : The monthly employee’s EPF contributions @ 12% of monthly wage which is deducted from wage of the employee is now to be paid by the Central Govt. in the EPF account of the eligible employee. So there will be no deduction from wages of eligible employee so he/she will have a higher take home salary.
Since the employer is also supported for employer’s share by the Govt., it prevents loss of employment of low wage earners and ensures payment of wages to employees.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 342 - How an employer of eligible establishment is benefitted by this Scheme?
Answer: Ans : Employer of eligible establishment is not required to pay his share of EPF & EPS contributions @12% of monthly wage of eligible employees of his establishment and so employer saves this money. This is an incentive to employers of small business to retain all his employees and pay them wages
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 343 - Can you illustrate the monetary benefit to an Employee & Employer under this Scheme?
Answer:
Ans : If an eligible employee draws a monthly wage of Rs.10000/-, Rs.1200/- which was to be paid into EPF by deduction from his monthly wage will now be paid by the Central Govt.
Further, in the above case, the employer is also not required to incur expenditure of Rs.1200/- from his finances as the Central Govt. pays the same.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 344 - So, Central Govt. will bear the entire liability under the EPF & MP Act, 1952 for eligible establishments?
Answer: Ans : The Central Govt. shall bear the entire liability towards the EPF & EPS contributions of the eligible employees in eligible establishment. The employer of eligible estts, shall continue to pay the EDLI contributions and EPF administrative charges for all employees as well as the EPF & EPS contributions for ineligible employees.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 345 - Whether this scheme  is applicable to employees in exempted establishment?
Answer: Ans : Yes, provided that the establishment meets the eligibility conditions as mentioned in Answer to Q3
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 346 - Whether the EPFO will communicate with the employers of the establishments found eligible from ECRs of month prior to March 2020?
Answer: Ans : Yes, EPFO will send communication in employer’s login to all such establishments for payment of wages to employees and filing of ECR. However, the eligibility will be validated on filing of ECR by employers for the wage months- March, 2020, April 2020 and May, 2020 and also with reference to information furnished in Form 5A.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 347 - How the benefits can be applied for and who has to apply, employer or employee?
Answer: Ans : The employer in relation to any eligible establishment, is required to disburse salary/wages for the month to all employees of the establishment, without deducting EPF contributions from wages of eligible employees and file Electronic Challan cum Return (ECR) for the month to claim benefit under this Scheme.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 348 - Is the employer required to file separate ECR for the eligible employees?
Answer: Ans : Each eligible establishment has to file only one valid ECR for each of three months in respect of its total employees both eligible as well as ineligible employees.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 349 - Is the employer required to file any other information other than ECR?
Answer: Ans : The Form 5A (Ownership return) should contain particulars of all branches and departments of the establishment and also code numbers, if any, taken for administrative convenience for the branches. The employer can update Form 5A online using his approved Digital Signature Certificate (DSC).
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 350 - Whether the contributions amount has to be initially paid by the establishment and thereafter reimbursed by Central Govt.?
Answer:
Ans : Once ECR is uploaded by an employer of eligible establishment, the challan will separately show such amounts of employees’ and employers’ contributions as Central Govt. relief due under this Scheme in respect of eligible employees and the remaining amount payable by the employer.
After the employer remits the payment due from him as reflected in challan as noted above, the EPF & EPS contributions in respect of eligible employees will be credited directly in their respective UAN by the Central Govt.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 351 - What is the responsibility of employer for availing the benefits?
Answer:
Ans : The employer must ensure to file correct information, statement or declaration for total number of employees, disbursement of wages, amount of wages in the ECR and full details of establishment in Form 5A. The employer is required to file a certificate/declaration in the format prescribed under 6 (vii) of the Scheme at the time of ECR submission.
If it is discovered that the information furnished or declaration made electronically in ECR or Form 5A or otherwise are false/incorrect, then the employer will be liable to refund the relief and also face the penal consequences for such contravention under the EPF & MP Act, 1952.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 352 - What is revised rate of EPF contribution announced by the Central Govt. under Atmanirbhar Bharat package?
Answer: Ans : Under this package the statutory rate of EPF contribution of both employer and employee has been reduced to 10 percent of basic wages and dearness allowances from existing rate of 12 percent for all class of establishments covered under the EPF & MP Act, 1952.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 353 - What is the objective of reduction in rate of contributions?
Answer: Ans : Reduction in rate of EPF contributions from 12% to 10% of basic wages and Dearness allowances is intended to benefit both 4.3 crore employees/members and employers of 6.5 lakhs establishments to tide over the immediate liquidity crisis to some extent during Pandemic situation.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 354 - Whether any notification has been issued under the EPF & MP Act, 1952 for reducing the rate of contributions? If so, how can I access the notification?
Answer: Ans : The reduction in statutory rate of contributions from 12% to 10% for wage months May, 2020, June, 2020 and July, 2020 has been notified vide SO 1513 (E) dated 18.05.2020 published in the Gazette of India. The notification is available under the TAB- COVID-19 on the home page of EPFO website.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 355 - What is the period for which reduced rate of contribution is applicable?
Answer: Ans : The statutory rate of contribution will be 10% for wage months- May, 2020, June, 2020 and July, 2020.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 356 - Who are eligible for the reduced rate of contributions?
Answer:
Ans : It is applicable to all class of establishments covered under the EPF & MP Act, 1952, except the establishments like Central and State Public Sector enterprises or any other establishment owned or controlled by or under control of the Central Govt. or State Govt.
The reduced rate is also not applicable to establishments eligible for PMGKY benefits, since the entire employees EPF contributions (12% of wages) and employers’ EPF & EPS contribution (12% of wages), totaling 24% of the monthly wages is being contributed by the Central Govt.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 357 - Are exempted establishments eligible for reduced rate of contribution?
Answer: Ans : Yes. The reduced rate is applicable to exempted establishments also.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 358 - How does the reduced rate of contributions help the employees and employer?
Answer: Ans : As a result of reduction in statutory rate of contributions from 12% to 10%, the employee shall have a higher take home pay due to reduction in deduction from his pay on account of EPF contributions and employer shall also have his liability reduced by 2% of wages of his employees. If Rs.10000/- is monthly EPF wages, only Rs.1000/- instead of Rs.1200/- is deducted from employee’s wages and employer pays Rs.1000/- instead of Rs.1200/- towards EPF contributions.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 359 - I get salary under Cost to Company (CTC) model, will the reduced rate of contributions from 12% to 10% still benefit me?
Answer:
Ans : In Cost to Company (CTC) model, if Rs.10000/- is monthly EPF wages, in CTC
Model the employee gets Rs.200/- more directly from employer as employer’s EPF/EPS contribution is reduced and Rs.200/- less is deducted from his/her wages.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 360 - Is the 10% rate of contribution applicable to establishments which get registered with EPFO during wage months May, 2020, June 2020 and July, 2020?
Answer: Ans : Yes. Establishments covered during wage months of May-July, 2020 will be eligible for reduced rate for eligible remaining period from date of coverage.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 361 - What will be rate of contribution for administrative charges and insurance?
Answer: Ans : There is no change in the EPF administrative charges (0.5% of EPF wages subject to minimum prescribed) and EDLI contributions (0.5% of wages) both payable by employers.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 362 - How is benefit availed? One has to pay at full rate and claim reimbursement later or direct payment at reduced rate can be made.
Answer: Ans : Establishment has to remit dues at reduced rate through the Electronic-Challan cum Return (ECR) itself.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 363 - Can the employer or employee pay at higher rate or the contribution rate of 10% is mandatory?
Answer: Ans : The reduced rate of contribution (10%) is minimum rate of contribution during period of the package. The employer, employee or both can contribute at higher rate also.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 364 - How the reduced rate of contribution will impact amount of pension in longer run?
Answer: Ans : The EPS contributions 8.33% of wages (subject to ceiling of Rs.15000/-) is diverted from employer’s share of EPF contributions. The reduced rate of EPF contributions to 10% will not reduce the pension contributions or benefits.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 365 - My establishment will not be able to remit dues timely during the scheme period. Is it still eligible for reduced rate of contribution?
Answer: Ans : Yes, the rate of contributions is 10% for the three wage months- May, 2020,
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 366 - Is the option to contribute at reduced rate available to establishments availing PMRPY benefits?
Answer: Ans : Yes. The establishment availing PMRPY benefits can remit contribution at reduced rate.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 367 - The rate of contribution for my establishment is 10% as it is engaged in manufacturing of gaur gum. Will the rate of contribution be further reduced for my establishment?
Answer: Ans : The establishments, which were already entitled to reduced rate of contribution (10%) through the SO 320 (E) dated 09.04.1997 are not eligible for any further reduction in rate of contribution.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 368 - What should I do if the employer/establishment does not pay EPF contribution after deducting the same from my wages?
Answer: Ans : In such a case, a complaint against the employer may be lodged with the EPFO (https://epfims.gov.in/epfoffice) along with a copy of the wage/salary slip clearly indicating the EPF deduction from the wage/salary. The statutory penal provisions of the Act shall be invoked against the establishment/employer to recover the dues from the employer. A complaint can also be lodged with Police under section 406/409 of IPC by any person for institution of criminal proceedings.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 369 - Whether an employer can recover Employer's share from a member?
Answer: Ans : Paragraph 31 of the EPF Scheme, 1952 prohibits the deduction of employer's share from the wages or otherwise to recover from the member.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 370 - Whether the EPF credited into the member's accounts can be attached against any liability?
Answer: Ans : Section 10 of the EPF and MP Act, 1952 grants protection to any amount standing the credit of any member in the Provident Fund, Pension Fund and Insurance Fund against all kinds of attachment.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 371 - If the wages are not collected by the member whether the PF can be deducted or not?
Answer: Ans : The employer, before paying the member his wages, is required to recover the employee's share from his wages and pay the contribution to the EPFO.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 372 - When a contractor is not paying the dues to EPFO, how the EPF contributions of contract employees are protected?
Answer: Ans : Section 8A of the Act enjoins upon the Principal Employer a statutory duty to ensure that a contractor discharges his liability. The Principal Employer may recover all EPF dues in respect of EPF members of the contractor from any amount payable to the said contractor. Moreover, paragraph 30 of the Scheme prescribes that the employer shall, in the first instance, pay the EPF dues in respect of all employees employed directly or through a contractor.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 373 - I am an employee working in an establishment to which the PF Act is not applicable. Can I become a member of the EPF?
Answer: Ans : An employee can become a member only if the Act applies to the establishment.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 374 - If an employee is not given the PF membership, to whom he can approach?
Answer: Ans : An employee, who is working in an establishment covered under the Act, and is eligible to become member of EPF Scheme but has not been enrolled as a member, should immediately approach the nearest EPF office along with all his particulars and the documentary evidence of his employment.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 375 - Whether an employee working in a Branch/Unit of an establishment situated outside the state is eligible to become a member of the EPF?
Answer: Ans : The Act applies to an establishment as a whole and hence, all its employees, irrespective of their place of work or location, must be enrolled if they are eligible to become member of the Scheme.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 376 - If a person is working in an establishment honorary (without any wages), whether he can be given the PF membership?
Answer: Ans : An employee, working in an establishment covered under the Act and who is not excluded by virtue of paragraph 2(f) of the EPF Scheme, 1952, is eligible to be enrolled as a member of the Scheme.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 377 - If the UAN is not seeded with Aadhaar, how the validation/seeding is possible in lockdown period?
Answer:
Ans :  Online e-KYC facility is available to member on EPFO Portal as well on UMANG mobile App to self-validate their UAN with Aadhaar without any intervention by Employer. This is in addition to Online Aadhaar validation in member’s UAN by employer.
Since the validation is Online, seeding of Aadhaar in UAN can be completed now also.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 378 - Whether PF will be payable only on the part of salary paid in India in case of split payroll ?
Answer: Ans : In case of Split payroll the contribution shall be paid on the total salary earned by the employees in the establishment covered in India.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 379 - Indian employees working abroad and contributing to the Social Security Scheme of that country with whom India has a Social Security Agreement, are they coverable for PF in India or treated as excluded employees ?
Answer:
Ans : 
The contribution shall be calculated on the basis of monthly pay containing the following
Components actually drawn during the whole month whether paid on daily, weekly, fortnightly or monthly basis :
 . Basic Wages
 . Dearness allowance (all cash payment by whatever name called paid to an employee on account of a rise in the cost of living)
 . Retaining allowance
 . Cash value of any food concession
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 380 - How long can an Indian employee retain the status of International Worker ?
Answer: Ans : An Indian employee once he/she returns to India and works in an EPF covered establishment in India shall contribute as Domestic Worker.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 381 - What is the procedure of withdrawal of PF for International Worker?
Answer:
Ans : PF withdrawal can be taken by submitting Form No 19 (online if UAN is linked to Aadhaar and Bank Account in India) to the concerned Regional / Sub .Regional Office in whose jurisdiction the establishment in which he /she was employed, is covered. As per provision of Para 72(2) under Para 83 of EPF Scheme, the due amount of an IW from SSA country can be paid to his bank account in India or
his home country.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 382 - What is the mechanism of payment to an International Worker from Non SSA country, who does not have bank account in India ?
Answer: Ans : The benefit of exportability of benefits is not allowed to nationals of Non SSA countries they can receive their PF accumulations either in Indian Bank account or through the employer .
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 383 - Indian employees working abroad and contributing to the social security scheme of a country with which India DOES NOT have a Social Security Agreement, are they coverable for PF in India ?
Answer: Ans : If an Indian employee is employed in any covered establishment in India and sent abroad on posting to a Non SSA country, he is liable to be a member/continue as a member in India as a domestic Indian employee, if otherwise eligible. He is not an International Worker as per the definition of International Workers under Para 83 of the EPF Scheme.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 384 - Monthly Pay. for calculating contributions to be paid under the Act ?
Answer:
Ans : 
The contribution shall be calculated on the basis of monthly pay containing the following
Components actually drawn during the whole month whether paid on daily, weekly, fortnightly or monthly basis :
 . Basic Wages
 . Dearness allowance (all cash payment by whatever name called paid to an employee on account of a rise in the cost of living)
 . Retaining allowance
 . Cash value of any food concession
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 385 - Under which circumstances TDS will be applicable in accordance with the Ministry of Finance Notification G.S.R. 604(E) dated 31.08.2021?
Answer:
Ans : TDS will be applicable in case of PF Final Settlement, transfer claims, on transfer
from Exempted establishments to EPFO and vice versa, on transfer from one Trust on
another, past accumulations transfer, at the time of annual accounts processing, on
back period accounting after accounts for year 2021-22 are processed in accordance
with the Ministry of Finance Notification G.S.R. 604(E) dated 31.08.2021 .
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
386 - What is the effective date of deduction of TDS in accordance with the
Ministry of Finance Notification G.S.R. 604(E) dated 31.08.2021?
Answer: Ans : it will be effective from 1st day of April, 2022.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 387 - Is there any minimum amount upto which tax is not deducted ?
Answer:
Ans : The threshold limit for contributions for previous year 2021-22 and subsequent
previous year is 2,50,000/- for EPF members.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 388 - Whether the TDS will be applicable in death cases.
Answer: Ans : Yes, TDS will be applicable in death cases as in the case of a live member.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
389 - Whether TDS will be applicable to Exempted Establishments and
Exempted Trusts.
Answer: Ans : Yes, TDS will be applicable to Exempted Establishments and Exempted Trusts.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 390 - Whether TDS will be applicable in case of International Workers.
Answer:
Ans : Yes, TDS will be applicable in case of International Workers as in the case of
Indian workers.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
391 - At what rate TDS will be deducted if PF account is linked with a valid
PAN for resident member?
Answer:
Ans : If PF account is linked with a valid PAN, rate of TDS shall be 10 percent.
(Ref. section 194 A)
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
392 - Whether TDS will be deducted if TDS amount is up to Rs 5000/- if
member being resident.
Answer:
Ans : No, TDS will not be deducted if TDS amount is up to Rs 5000/- if member is a
resident. However, the member’s individual tax Liability towards his total tax shall
remain.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
393 - Whether TDS will be deducted if TDS amount is upto Rs 5000/- if
member being nonresident.
Answer: Ans : TDS will be deducted at the applicable rates.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
394 - Is it mandatory for EPF member to disclose his PAN details with EPFO /
link PAN with UAN ?
Answer:
Ans : As per section 206AA of IT Act, every taxpayer who receives taxable income needs
to furnish their PAN to the payer (EPFO) of such income.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
395 - At what rate TDS will be deducted in case of resident member if PAN is
not linked/ invalid PAN?
Answer:
Ans : 
If the PF Account is not linked with a valid PAN, tax shall be deducted at the
higher of the following rates
 (i) at the rate specified in the relevant provision of 206AA of the IT Act; or 
 (ii) at the rate or rates in force; or 
 (iii) at the rate of twenty per cent: 
 (Ref. section 194 A read with section 206 AA of Income Tax Act)
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
396 - At what rate TDS will be deducted if PF account is linked with a valid
PAN for nonresident member ?
Answer:
Ans : If PF account is linked with a valid PAN, rate of TDS shall be 30 percent or tax
rate as specified in the DTAA (Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement) whichever is
beneficial to PF member.
(Ref. section 195 of IT Act read with section 90 of IT Act)
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
397 - At what rate TDS will be deducted in case of nonresident member if
PAN is not linked/ invalid PAN?
Answer:
Ans : If PF account is not linked with a valid PAN, rate of TDS shall be 30 percent or tax
rate as specified in the DTAA (Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement) whichever is
beneficial to PF member.
(Ref. section 195 of IT Act read with section 90 of IT Act)
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
398 - Whether surcharge and cess will also be applicable in case of TDS
deduction in case of member being non-resident?
Answer:
Ans : 
Yes, cess @ 4 % of TDS.
 Rate of Surcharge is as under:
 For interest upto Rs. 50 lacs- Nil
 For interest above Rs. 50 lacs and upto 1 crore – 10 %
 For interest above Rs. 1 crore and upto 2 crore – 15%
 For interest above Rs. 2 crore and upto 5 crore – 25%
 For interest above Rs. 5 crore and upto 10 crore – 37%
 For interest exceeding Rs. 10 crore – 37%
 (For FY 2021-22 / AY 2022-23)
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
399 - Whether surcharge and cess will also be applicable in case of TDS
under section 194 A ?
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
400 - In case of death of a member, whose (EPF member or nominee) PAN
will be considered for deduction of TDS?
Answer: Ans : Deduction of tax will be same as in case of a live EPF Member.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 401 - Is there any declaration / form to be submitted by EPF member for claiming benefits of tax rates as per DTAA ?
Answer:
Ans : Yes, as per section 90 of IT Act member has to submit form 10 F and form 10 FB
of Income Tax.
[Ref. Sub-rule (1) of rule 21 AB and rule 21 AB (4)]
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 402 - By which date TDS deducted is to be deposited?
Answer:
Ans : For the month of March ----- by 30th April of next financial year.
 For other months ------ by 7th of next month.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 403 - How to deposit TDS?
Answer: Ans : Tax Deducted at Source has to be deposited using Challan ITNS-281.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 404 - What is the rate of interest for not deduction of TDS?
Answer:
Ans : As per Section 201 of IT Act, Interest will be levied @ 1 % for every month or
part of a month on the amount of such tax from the date such tax was deductible.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 405 - What is the rate of interest for not depositing of TDS deducted?
Answer:
Ans : Interest @ 1.5 % for every month or a part of a month on the amount of such tax
from the date on which such tax was deducted to the date on which such tax is actually
paid to the credit of the Government.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 406 - What is date for filing fee of TDS statement / return ?
Answer:
Ans : Due date for furnishing the TDS return in form 26Q for TDS u/s 194A and in 27Q if TDS is deducted u/s 195.
Quarter Due Date of filing TDS return

Question: 407 - what is penalty for not filing of TDS return?
Answer:
Ans : Rs.200 for every day during which the failure continues. The amount of late fees
however shall not exceed the amount of TDS.
(ref section 200(3) read with section 234 E)

408 - Is there any return to be filed by tax deductor with Income Tax
department?

Ans : 
Yes, (i) Form 26Q - Statement of deduction of tax under section 194
 (ii) Form 27Q - Statement of deduction of tax under section 195 in respect

company or resident but not ordinarily resident.

Question: 409 - What are due dates for filing form 26 Q, 27 Q of Income Tax ?
Answer:
Ans : 
Due date for filing of TDS return (Both for Government and other Deductor) is as
under: 
 (i) For 1st quarter i.e from April to June ------- 31st July of the financial year
 (ii) For 2nd quarter i.e from July to September ------- 31st October of the financial year 
 (iii) For 3rd quarter i.e from October to December ------- 31st January of the financial year
 (iv) For 4th quarter i.e from January to March------- 31st May of the financial year immediately following the financial year in which deduction is made

Question:
410 - In case of Inter Office Transfer from One Regional Office to another,
how TDS will be calculated?
Answer:
Ans : In case of Inter Office Transfer from One Regional Office to another, details of
month wise contributions during the financial year 2021-22 have to be shared through
revised Annexure-K. The detail of total Taxable contribution along with its interest and
TDS deducted (if any) is also to be shared through Annexure –K. Further, Opening
Balance and Closing Balance along with withdrawals (separately for Taxable and NonTaxable part will also have to be shared).
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question: 411 - In case of Exempted Trust to EPFO, how TDS will be calculated?
Answer:
Ans : In case of Exempted Trust to EPFO, Exempted Trusts have to intimate to EPFO
the month wise amount of Employee share of contribution of the member and TDS (if
any) deducted and details of month wise contribution for the previous year 2021-22
and all subsequent previous years have to be shared through Annexure-K or other
mode. The detail of total taxable contribution along with its interest and TDS deducted
(if any) is also to be shared through Annexure –K. Further, Opening Balance and
Closing Balance along with withdrawals (separately for Taxable and Non-Taxable part
will also have to be shared).
On the basis of information provided by the Exempted Trust, EPFO will arrive at the
total employee share during the previous year 2021-22 and subsequent previous year
and interest thereof against the member/UAN and TDS amount after subtracting of TDS
already deducted/ deposited (if any) against such member, EPFO while processing
annual accounts/ claim settlement/ transfer of PF account of such members shall
deposit the balance amount of TDS at the applicable rate.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
412 - In case of Transfer from EPFO to Exempted Trust, how TDS will be
calculated?
Answer:
Ans : In case of Transfer from EPFO to Exempted Trust, EPFO has to
intimate to an Exempted Trust about the month wise amount of Employee
share of contribution of the member and TDS (if any) deducted. Details of
month wise contribution for the previous year 2021-22 and all subsequent
previous years have to be shared through Annexure-K or other mode. The
detail of total Taxable contribution along with its interest and TDS deducted
(if any) is also to be shared through Annexure –K. Further, Opening Balance
and Closing Balance along with withdrawals (separately from Taxable and
Non-Taxable part) will also be shared. On the basis of information provided by the EPFO, the Trust will arrive at the total employee share and interest
thereof against the member/UAN and TDS amount after subtracting TDS
already deducted/ deposited against such member. Exempted Trusts while
processing the annual accounts/ settlement/ transfer of PF account of such
members will have to deposit the balance TDS on interest in taxable account.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Question:
413 - What are the details to be shared in Annexure-K while transferring the
fund from previous account to current account?
Answer:
Ans : The month wise amount of Employee share of contribution of the member and
TDS (if any) deducted and details of month wise contribution for the previous year
2021-22 and all subsequent previous years have to be shared through Annexure-K or
other mode. The detail of total taxable contribution along with its interest and TDS
deducted (if any) is also to be shared through Annexure –K. Further, Opening Balance
and Closing Balance along with withdrawals (separately for Taxable and Non-Taxable
part will also have to be shared).
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

accounting of interest?

and maintenance as the closing balance of this part will earn interest next year and will
be subject to TDS.

Question: 417 - Is there any financial loss to EPF members due to the delay in updating of interest in the member passbook?
Answer: Ans : Updating of member passbook with interest is an entry process. The date on which the interest is entered in the passbook of the member has no actual financial bearing as the interest earned for the year on his monthly running balances is always added to the closing balance of that year and it becomes the opening balance for the next year. Hence, the member does not suffer any financial loss in case there is any delay in updating interest in his passbook. Further, if a member withdraws his EPF dues before the interest is updated in his passbook, in that case also at the time of his claim settlement, the due interest is calculated and paid from the date it becomes due automatically by the system. Hence, there is no financial loss to a member in the mentioned later case also.
instruction: Provide an accurate and concise response to the following question related to EPFO in english.

Visit EPFO Website
